document.title: English Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools March 2024

20E8041DCCB5400697142BE0631983B3.description:
Demonstrate ethical and responsible use of all sources, including the Internet, Artificial
Intelligence (AI), and new technologies, as they develop.

BD346D76496B4476BE0F334B708471FA.description:
Define the meaning and consequences of plagiarism and follow ethical and legal guidelines
for gathering and using information.

34B61874B03B4D98B1300889963CFB9D.description:
Cite sources for quoted and paraphrased ideas using a standard method of documentation,
such as the Modern Language Association (MLA) or the American Psychological
Association (APA).

A1A9F293EC2D4573AE80AD12E3EAE6E4.description: Create research products aligned with the demands of the reading and writing standards.

8A037FE922C9488EB4BC354DD1326209.description: Synthesize multiple streams of evidence to support claims and acknowledge counterclaims.

A63F227274D845C4847084E25AC896B1.description:
Objectively evaluate primary and secondary sources for their credibility, reliability,
accuracy, usefulness, and limitations; that includes identifying the main and supporting
ideas, points of view, conflicting information, and any misconceptions or biases.

701DD2A316C442C19A6802A6E4FC3D2F.description: Gather and organize information from various sources.

F85D317B72314FF5977E0EA256253E6E.description:
Formulate and revise questions about a research topic broadening or narrowing the inquiry
as necessary.

A5C07AD0DCD2421EB061A146FE240C3F.description:
The student will conduct research and read a series of conceptually related texts on
selected topics to build knowledge on grade-twelve content, texts, and areas prompted by
student interest.

9EB9A1F8E92445199644E6690195F4E9.description:
Analyze media to determine the cause-and-effect relationship(s) between media coverage
and public opinion trends.

3EAB2E74D00D44B3A2F0A23AC42F3ABC.description:
Explain and analyze how values and viewpoints are included or excluded and how media
influences beliefs, interpretations, and behaviors.

56F791EEDAF14C03B3AC7B1365B76E68.description:
Analyze and evaluate how the media's use of symbolism, imagery, metaphor, and bias
impacts the message.

BA49844872324F25AE9FC1963E6087E2.description:
Analyze and critique the effectiveness of media messages by evaluating the purpose,
evidence, and clarity for specific purposes with targeted audiences.

C6351A7FDDBD4513BC4AF7B168E8C84D.description:
Defend hypotheses about an author’s underlying values, viewpoints, and purposes and
reflect on how they shape the content.

1CD2B724F2D640E29599B6B84EFE8D3A.description: Provide appropriate citation of all content from external sources.

05ED220E2EE84A0486E76C5CED8308FB.description:
Organize information to create media messages with visual, audio, and graphic components
to convey meaning.

75B48C2B2DBE4C6CA8C700A96CE2A433.description:
Synthesize multiple streams of information on the same or similar topic to create a
summary or formulate a position.

18EB73FE12824EE1949CCBB8AE31F3B8.description:
Examine multimodal sources’ claims, arguments, ideas, and any point of personal bias by
evaluating them for reliability and relevance to serve as credible supporting evidence.

C3865E762D2F464DB87119ADB7B30BA6.description:
Create and deliver planned, multimodal, interactive presentations collaboratively and
individually for a variety of purposes and audiences.

78424ACED07143118D38FF79CC94DF50.description:
Memorize and recite an excerpt or monologue from a dramatic work portraying the
emotions and motivations of the character through voice and body language that conveys
the intended tone and mood of the selection.

BA9F943AA8784E53A0DCB870724C2B2A.description:
Evaluating the content and effectiveness of one's presentations, including the
introduction, organization, strengths/weaknesses and evidence and reasoning, and
conclusion.

CDCC426DE34E4FE5952F8047F7597EB6.description:
Monitoring audience engagement effectively and adjusting delivery accordingly during
presentations.

E941771C7EE94729A1B6314B2B5F7FAC.description:
Anticipating and addressing alternative or opposing perspectives and counterclaims and
rebuttals, as appropriate.

C92EE6A20A724EC08EFF41EABE7B45C6.description:
Incorporating various rhetorical devices to enhance purpose and strengthening clarity of
ideas.

2579E5A7AA8D4DCC9B8D69502FFD33C4.description:
Choosing appropriate vocabulary, language, and tone for a selected topic, purpose,
context, and audience when speaking and presenting.

5E39ACE3590C44A4B9A1A9664217AF1D.description:
Selecting the modes and purposes for presentations and synthesizing multiple streams
of information.

7EDEFAA93B9A44389237882D3A017E5D.description: Report orally on a topic or text or present an opinion. This includes:

1B5ED9A7FD4F47A2A64590EE89FDF0A1.description:
Using reflection to evaluate one's own role in the group process in small group
activities.

1B8A8890927C4142891E20B47CE8B0DE.description:
Evaluating the content of presentations, including introduction, organization,
strengths/weaknesses and evidence and reasoning, and conclusion.

8D4BBA13E89647C2ADA5DFCABB683D8E.description:
Selecting and applying multimodal tools to design and develop presentation content
appropriate for topic and purpose.

ACB7BB4BA17742B3A11468F5D47C87E4.description: Summarizing points of agreement and disagreement.

D1852EE28DB44BF1A937397CEC092EAC.description: Responding thoughtfully and tactfully with evidence to diverse perspectives.

C40B069DE42F485592BD08DAC4E7E849.description:
Applying a variety of strategies to listen actively and speak purposefully and
respectfully.

B07FC59F59F3408686751CEA1A540E15.description:
Facilitate and contribute to a range of sustained collaborative discussions with diverse
partners on grade twelve topics and texts. This includes:

36160ADD828A4232B59054709D412B51.description:
The student will develop effective oral communication and collaboration skills to build
a community of learners that process, understand, and interpret content together.

F91D9C10904B443EAE6E7259A1F00CDB.description: Spell correctly, consulting reference materials to check as needed.

541048D5E67049788A74BC74D2D92B22.description:
Apply a style manual, such as that of the Modern Language Association (MLA) or the
American Psychological Association (APA), to apply rules for punctuation and formatting
of direct quotations in writing.

F6A2CAE1F27943A0A31CF36AFDA0AD7E.description:
Use various clauses (independent, dependent, noun, relative, adverbial) to infuse sentence
variety, add interest, and enhance meaning and purpose.

6CE67B3FBC474E2E8449C7AB2393ACA3.description:
The student will use the conventions of Standard English when speaking and writing,
differentiating between contexts that call for formal English and situations where informal
discourse is more appropriate.

15EC94A0A1AE41D88B897968FA3CE97D.description:
Write and revise to a standard acceptable both in the workplace and in postsecondary
education.

4B7A7A7AAE3E40DE8369037D1CB666EF.description:
Edit writing for appropriate conventions, style, and language in informal and formal
contexts. (See Language Usage for grade level expectations)

8CA9DF47A9ED40478E0DE02C8C999F02.description:
Use peer- and self-evaluation to edit writing for clarity and quality of information,
addressing strengths and making suggestions regarding how writing might be improved.

B70B334B41DB424984555552FD76C715.description: Revise writing for clarity of content, accuracy, and depth of information.

D6C7DDC651C74F99B89B09DDFBF242C9.description:
Elaborating ideas clearly and effectively through syntactic structure, subordination of
ideas, sensory/ concrete details, diction, and purposeful word choice.

15676B5AE64B42279051B9A5A799E0CE.description:
Embedding narrative techniques and organizing information logically and effectively to
guide the audience from one idea to another with transitional words and phrases.

A9D50CA3A4BD4C77909A74904EC7D626.description:
Contextualizing evidence from sources effectively with proper introduction and
thorough explanation and appropriate citation.

A3CDC88C67374B1BA735C9629590D807.description:
Selecting appropriate evidence from multiple texts to clarify ideas, illustrate a
counterargument, and/or strengthen a thesis in writing.

BBF38E752B50456EBBE7C244295F4AA5.description:
Organizing claims, counterclaims, and evidence in a sustained and logical sequence to
exhibit unity.

0838E64993B74F1D8A16DDBFD2E3712A.description:
Composing a thesis statement that clearly communicates the writer’s position or
assertion.

0CB5A346178D4819A5DD971C3A53097D.description:
Plan and organize writing to address a specific audience and purpose using the writing
process (planning, drafting, revising, editing). This includes:

5E3A8AA0DC3D431C9A708BF83939B166.description:
Blend multiple modes of writing, by routinely engaging in the production of shorter and
longer pieces that adapt vocabulary, voice, and tone for a range of audiences, purposes, and
tasks (e.g., summaries, reflections, descriptions, critiques, letters, poetry, narratives, etc.).

BB4F75C677FF44F8AE3D855D8F518075.description:
Generate technical writing (e.g., job description, questionnaire, job application, or
business communication) that clearly address specific audiences with identified
purposes.

D3BF7C2860984D049EBBFD9EAC022AB3.description:
Create clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style
matches the intended audience and purpose of the workplace and/or post-secondary
education and language in informal and formal contexts.

E3C6909C1BD44496B1B1838BB8F1E398.description: Describe personal qualifications for potential occupational or educational opportunities.

80811ECACB00480596264A014D3291A7.description:
Provide a concluding section that follows from the information or explanation
presented.

CD76F48457BB4D4099C30D9E85B1265D.description:
Develop the topic through sustained use of the most significant and relevant facts,
concrete details, quotations, or other information from multiple authoritative sources
appropriate to the audience’s knowledge.

E12029461B1F432EAD85849D077AB034.description: Adopt an organizational structure that clarifies relationships among ideas and concepts.

160C4F65A1EA49CE8053E342B294E93E.description:
Introduce a topic clearly by providing context, presenting well-defined theses, and
previewing what follows.

F7356A00FBC64C349CA0DE29D842A846.description:
The student will write in a variety of forms for diverse audiences and purposes linked
to grade twelve content and text, with an emphasis on technical writing.

9419FF17AAAE48D59574D784A4067764.description:
Analyze how the author organizes an analysis or series of ideas or events, including the
order in which the points are made, how they are introduced and developed, and the
connections that are drawn between them.

8AF1D47B16AF49198348CD736483DD9B.description:
Evaluate texts with differing points of view on the same or similar events or issues by
assessing claims, reasoning, evidence, and connections to other works or historical events.

BAAD347FFAB54F7995E234BF4D1DAAAF.description:
Analyze the cumulative impact of specific word choices on meaning, author’s attitude
toward the subject, and mood.

689FCBEC055F45108DFAE9C839B35319.description:
Analyze text structures to discern how they affect the meaning and message of
informational and technical writing and how their text structures differ from those in
narrative texts.

FA58CC69482E4C3DB9E85A4A187AA567.description:
Analyze the argument and specific claims in texts, examining whether the reasoning is
valid, the evidence is relevant, and whether there are any false premises or unsupported
claims.

3E460614D41F4FC8A9A5E7569B8DEC62.description:
Evaluate the effectiveness of the structure(s) and rhetorical devices authors use in their
exposition or argument, including how the structure advances their point of view.

CC3C3D1FAC3C4E39A625F6016906E7D8.description:
Interpret and complete an application for employment or college admission, and summarize
the intent, main ideas, and purpose of the workplace or technical documents.

D653A35ECAEF444285E08B5EB245E2BB.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from grade-level complex informational texts read.

C245D5B3E8EF4B1A85360DDA174FE256.description:
Analyze how authors’ attitudes, viewpoints, and beliefs reflect larger historical, social, or
cultural contexts.

AF9023641D5E4BA0AB99F624DADEC76F.description:
Compare and contrast the development of a universal theme over the course of two or more
literary works including how each theme emerges and is shaped and refined by specific
details.

8FFFE9AE53E74DEDAC1228F7CD21169C.description:
Compare and contrast traditional and contemporary texts that draw on similar themes,
patterns of events, or character types with an emphasis on poetry, from various cultures.

CDB6F509AC5E42388B4E95ABFB717773.description:
Evaluate the use of satire, sarcasm, irony, and understatement to differentiate between what
is directly stated and what is implied.

68C41712F9874034B2B680CEB871C6AF.description:
Interpret and analyze how authors create intended effects using diction and impact the tone
and mood of the story, play, or poem.

82860AF02D304F98959BDF93689837B4.description:
Evaluate how the use of figurative language in poetry and prose contributes to the reader’s
understanding of the subject, form, mood, and theme.

AB1C5CE78C364FE1806FF4E9B94D53A2.description:
Analyze and evaluate how dramatic conventions (e.g., soliloquy, aside, narration, direct
address to the audience) contribute to the theme and effect of plays from various cultures.

CCED18DECD4C4877B9A8E57D2341B455.description:
Analyze how complex characters-those with multiple or conflicting motivations-develop
over the course of texts, interact with other characters, and advance the plot.

732CDB2A499B4672A1B97BB1E5C1D503.description:
Examine how authors structure a text and order events within it through parallel episodes,
subplots, and conflicts, and explain how they create such effects as mystery, tension, or
surprise.

74ED048D047449749A0E8EB634F35ED8.description:
Analyze the development of universal themes (e.g., loss of innocence, coming of age,
relationship with nature) prevalent in British literature (e.g., short stories, poems, plays,
novels, essays, and literary nonfiction) of different eras.

CD26BE7C5CF94738BB9A4C2668FB4A7A.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from a variety of grade-level complex literary texts read to include literary
nonfiction (including world, British and American literature), narratives, poetry, and drama,
with an emphasis on British literature.

AC6EC12E90D4483D803DD1783312E602.description:
Use newly learned words and phrases in multiple contexts, including in students’
discussions and speaking and writing activities.

F44A198803A544AF8BE97F33B11A4585.description:
Interpret the meaning of figurative language and literary and classical allusions and analyze
their role in texts.

B9B85AE9CA81455B8B855B77EAFCAF18.description: Explain and analyze idiomatic language in context.

173C56E4EA764DED824DC6878AFBDEFA.description:
Analyze the nuances in the meaning of words with similar denotations (e.g., assertive,
aggressive, domineering).

BCCA56D7C90F4C8FB64E4753DE301C77.description:
Use structural analysis of roots, affixes, and etymology to understand the meanings of
unfamiliar and complex words.

92E6FED1246B46899449E61041613E2F.description: Use context and sentence structure to clarify the meanings of words and phrases.

A00C2A1DA98F4501B3169945D20564FE.description:
Develop and accurately use general academic and content-specific vocabulary through
reading, discussing, and writing about grade-level texts and topics.

16340A4973D4405FBAB8875A0ABDB3A8.description:
The student will systematically build vocabulary and word knowledge based on grade
twelve content and texts.

5368ED7A74144020959480ADF362D79A.description:
Use reading strategies as needed to aid and monitor comprehension when encountering
challenging sections of text. These sense-making strategies attend to text structure,
common organizational structures, summarizing, asking questions of the text, and others
(Reading Strategies, 3-12).

8C71F7B998FD4EF1A69C081A0B4FA99E.description:
Regularly engage in reading a series of conceptually related texts organized around topics
of study to build knowledge and vocabulary (These texts should be at a range of
complexity levels so students can read the texts independently, with peers, or with modest support.). Use this background knowledge as context for new learning. (Deep Reading on
Topics to Build Knowledge and Vocabulary, K-12).

287E1EF5B1384CA6999C3D3CD275B8B4.description:
When responding to text through discussions and/or writing, draw several pieces of
evidence from grade-level complex texts to support claims, conclusions, and inferences,
including quoting or paraphrasing from texts accurately and tracing where relevant
evidence is located (Textual Evidence, K-12).

6BF84A79725742EC8FAF3836C922E9F3.description:
Proficiently read and comprehend a variety of literary and informational texts that exhibit
complexity at the higher range of the grades 11-12 band to generate and respond logically
to literal, inferential, evaluative, synthesizing, and critical thinking questions (See the
Quantitative and Qualitative Analysis charts for determining complexity in the Appendix.).
(Text Complexity, 2-12).

C0C006EB5FB74659A9DB503C32F7EC2D.description:
Read a variety of grade-level complex text with accuracy, automaticity, appropriate rate,
and meaningful expression in successive readings to support comprehension. Monitor
while reading to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, as necessary
(Reading Fluency, K-12).

C68D78FA3E6A4D94B8D8FCAE2CC8BF32.description:
The student will build knowledge and comprehension skills from reading a range of
challenging, content-rich texts. This includes fluently reading and gathering evidence from
grade-level complex texts, reading widely on topics to gain purposeful knowledge and
vocabulary, and using reading strategies when comprehension breaks down.

1960C0C240C44F0FA66FA3D63D396546.description: Developing Skilled and Building Reading Stamina
